summary.long: Acts is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: I produced the former account, O Theophilus, about all that Jesus began to do and to teach,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until the day he was taken up, after he had given orders through the Holy Spirit to the apostles whom he had chosen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom he also presented himself alive after he suffered, with many convincing proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days and speaking the things about the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was with them, he commanded them, “Do not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for what was promised by the Father, which you heard about from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had come together, they began asking him, saying, “Lord, is it at this time you are restoring the kingdom to Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “It is not for you to know the times or seasons that the Father has set by his own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the farthest part of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had said these things, while they were watching, he was taken up, and a cloud received him from their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were staring into the sky while he was departing, behold, two men in white clothing stood by them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also said, “Men of Galilee, why do you stand there looking into the sky? This Jesus who was taken up from you into heaven like this will come back in the same way you saw him departing into heaven!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain that is called Olive Grove which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had entered, they went up to the upstairs room where they were staying—Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot and Judas son of James.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were busily engaged with one mind in prayer, together with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus and with his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the brothers (and it was a crowd of persons of about one hundred twenty at the same place) and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men and brothers, it was necessary that the scripture be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit proclaimed beforehand through the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was counted among us and received a share in this ministry.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now this man acquired a field for the wages of his wickedness, and falling headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his intestines spilled out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it became known to all who live in Jerusalem, so that that field was called in their own language “Akeldama,” that is, “Field of Blood.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For it is written in the book of Psalms,
‘Let his residence become deserted,
    and let there be no one to live in it,’
and,
‘Let another person take his position.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is necessary for one of the men who have accompanied us during all the time in which the Lord Jesus went in and went out among us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beginning from the baptism of John until the day on which he was taken up from us—one of these men must become a witness of his resurrection together with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they proposed two men, Joseph called Barsabbas (who was called Justus) and Matthias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they prayed and said, “You, Lord, who know the hearts of all, show clearly which one of these two you have chosen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to take the place in this ministry and apostleship from which Judas turned aside to depart to his own place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they cast lots for them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was added to serve with the eleven apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the day of Pentecost had come, they were all together in the same place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly a sound like a violent rushing wind came from heaven and filled the whole house where they were sitting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And divided tongues like fire appeared to them and rested on each one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other languages as the Spirit gave them ability to speak out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were Jews residing in Jerusalem, devout men from every nation under heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when this sound occurred, the crowd gathered and was in confusion, because each one was hearing them speaking in his own language.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were astounded and astonished, saying, “Behold, are not all these who are speaking Galileans?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And how do we hear, each one of us, in our own native language?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Parthians and Medes and Elamites and those residing in Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya toward Cyrene, and the Romans who were in town,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: both Jews and proselytes, Cretans and Arabs—we hear them speaking in our own languages the great deeds of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all were amazed and greatly perplexed, saying to one another, “What can this mean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But others jeered and said, “They are full of sweet new wine!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter, standing with the eleven, raised his voice and declared to them, “Judean men, and all those who live in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and pay attention to my words!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these men are not drunk, as you assume, because it is the third hour of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is what was spoken through the prophet Joel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘And it will be in the last days,’ God says,
    ‘I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh,
        and your sons and your daughters will prophesy,
        and your young men will see visions,
        and your old men will dream dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And even on my male slaves and on my female slaves
    I will pour out my Spirit in those days, and they will prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will cause wonders in the heaven above
    and signs on the earth below,
    blood and fire and vapor of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun will be changed to darkness
    and the moon to blood,
    before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be that everyone who calls upon the name of the Lord will be saved.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Israelite men, listen to these words! Jesus the Nazarene, a man attested to you by God with deeds of power and wonders and signs that God did through him in your midst, just as you yourselves know—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this man, delivered up by the determined plan and foreknowledge of God, you executed by nailing to a cross through the hand of lawless men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God raised him up, having brought to an end the pains of death, because it was not possible for him to be held by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David says with reference to him,
‘I saw the Lord before me continually,
    for he is at my right hand so that I will not be shaken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this reason my heart was glad
    and my tongue rejoiced greatly,
    furthermore also my flesh will live in hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you will not abandon my soul in Hades,
    nor will you permit your Holy One to experience decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made known to me the paths of life;
    you will fill me with gladness with your presence.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men and brothers, it is possible to speak with confidence to you about the patriarch David, that he both died and was buried, and his tomb is with us until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, because he was a prophet and knew that God had sworn to him with an oath to seat one of his descendants on his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by having foreseen this, he spoke about the resurrection of the Christ, that neither was he abandoned in Hades nor did his flesh experience decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Jesus God raised up, of which we all are witnesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, having been exalted to the right hand of God and having received the promise of the Holy Spirit from the Father, he has poured out this that you see and hear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For David did not ascend into heaven, but he himself says,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at my right hand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let all the house of Israel know beyond a doubt, that God has made him both Lord and Christ—this Jesus whom you crucified!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard this, they were pierced to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, “What should we do, men and brothers?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized, each one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the promise is for you and for your children, and for all those who are far away, as many as the Lord our God calls to himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with many other words he solemnly urged and exhorted them, saying, “Be saved from this crooked generation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So those who accepted his message were baptized, and on that day about three thousand souls were added.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were devoting themselves to the teaching of the apostles and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fear came on every soul, and many wonders and signs were being performed by the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who believed were in the same place, and had everything in common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began selling their possessions and property, and distributing these things to all, to the degree that anyone had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every day, devoting themselves to meeting with one purpose in the temple courts and breaking bread from house to house, they were eating their food with joy and simplicity of heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord was adding every day to the total of those who were being saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Peter and John were going up to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain man was being carried who was lame from birth. He was placed every day at the gate of the temple called “Beautiful,” so that he could ask for charitable gifts from those who were going into the temple courts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he saw Peter and John about to go into the temple courts, he began asking to receive alms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter looked intently at him, together with John, and said, “Look at us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he fixed his attention on them, expecting to receive something from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Silver and gold I do not possess, but what I have, this I give to you—in the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, walk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And taking hold of him by the right hand, he raised him up, and immediately his feet and ankles were made strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaping up, he stood and began walking around and entered into the temple courts with them, walking and leaping and praising God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they recognized him, that this one was the one who used to sit asking for alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple, and they were filled with awe and astonishment at what had happened to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was holding fast to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the portico called Solomon’s, utterly astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw it, Peter replied to the people, “Men and Israelites, why are you astonished at this? Or why are you staring at us, as if by our own power or godliness we have made him walk?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his servant Jesus, whom you handed over and denied in the presence of Pilate, after he had decided to release him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you denied the Holy and Righteous One and demanded that a man—a murderer—be granted to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you killed the originator of life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the basis of faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know, and the faith that is through him has given him this perfect health in the presence of you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, brothers, I know that you acted in ignorance, just as your rulers did also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the things which God foretold through the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ would suffer, he has fulfilled in this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore repent and turn back, so that your sins may be blotted out,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord, and he may send the Christ appointed for you—Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom heaven must receive until the times of the restoration of all things, about which God spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets from earliest times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, ‘The Lord God will raise up for you a prophet like me from your brothers. You will listen to him in everything that he says to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be that every soul who does not listen to that prophet will be destroyed utterly from the people.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And indeed, all the prophets from Samuel and all those who followed him have spoken about and proclaimed these days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant that God ordained with your fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your offspring all the nations of the earth will be blessed.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God, after he had raised up his servant, sent him to you first, to bless you by turning each of you back from your wickedness!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were speaking to the people, the priests and the captain of the temple and the Sadducees approached them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: greatly annoyed because they were teaching the people and proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laid hands on them and put them in custody until the next day, because it was already evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But many of those who listened to the message believed, and the number of the men was approximately five thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that on the next day, their rulers and elders and scribes came together in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas and John and Alexander, and all those who were from the high priest’s family.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made them stand in their midst and began to ask, “By what power or by what name did you do this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if we are being examined today concerning a good deed done to a sick man—by what means this man was healed—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let it be known to all of you and to all the people of Israel that by the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead—by him this man stands before you healthy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one is the stone that was rejected by you, the builders, that has become the cornerstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there is salvation in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven that is given among people by which we must be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and understood that they were uneducated and untrained men, they were astonished, and recognized them, that they had been with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because they saw the man who had been healed standing there with them, they had nothing to say in return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after they had ordered them to go outside the Sanhedrin, they began to confer with one another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “What should we do with these men? For that a remarkable sign has taken place through them is evident to all those who live in Jerusalem, and we are not able to deny it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in order that it may not spread much further among the people, let us warn them to speak no more in this name to anyone at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called them back and commanded them not to speak or to teach at all in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and John answered and said to them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you rather than God, you decide!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are not able to refrain from speaking about the things that we have seen and heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after threatening them further, they released them, finding no way to punish them on account of the people, because they were all praising God for what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the man on whom this sign of healing had been performed was more than forty years old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they were released, they went to their own people and reported all that the chief priests and the elders had said to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard it, they lifted their voices with one mind to God and said, “Master, you are the one who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all the things in them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the one who said by the Holy Spirit through the mouth of our father David, your servant,
‘Why do the nations rage,
    and the peoples conspire in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth stood opposed,
    and the rulers assembled together at the same place,
against the Lord and against his Christ.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in truth both Herod and Pontius Pilate, together with the Gentiles and the peoples of Israel, assembled together in this city against your holy servant Jesus whom you anointed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to do all that your hand and plan had predestined to take place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, Lord, concern yourself with their threats and grant your slaves to speak your message with all boldness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you extend your hand to heal and signs and wonders are performed through the name of your holy servant Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak the word of God with boldness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the group of those who believed were one heart and soul, and no one said anything of what belonged to him was his own, but all things were theirs in common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with great power the apostles were giving testimony to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was on them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there was not even anyone needy among them, because all those who were owners of plots of land or houses were selling them and bringing the proceeds of the things that were sold
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and placing them at the feet of the apostles. And it was being distributed to each as anyone had need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph, who was called Barnabas by the apostles (which is translated “son of encouragement”), a Levite of Cyprus by nationality,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sold a field that belonged to him and brought the money and placed it at the feet of the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, sold a piece of property,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he kept back for himself some of the proceeds, and his wife was aware of it. And he brought a certain part and placed it at the feet of the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Ananias, for what reason has Satan filled your heart, that you lied to the Holy Spirit and kept back for yourself some of the proceeds of the piece of land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it remained to you, did it not remain yours? And when it was sold, was it at your disposal? How is it that you have contrived this deed in your heart? You have not lied to people, but to God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Ananias heard these words, he fell down and died. And great fear came on all those who heard about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the young men stood up, wrapped him up, and carried him out and buried him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that there was an interval of about three hours, and his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said to her, “Tell me whether you both were paid this much for the piece of land.” And she said, “Yes, this much.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter said to her, “How is it that it was agreed by you two to test the Spirit of the Lord? Behold, the feet of those who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately she fell down at his feet and died. So when the young men came in, they found her dead, and carried her out and buried her with her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And great fear came on the whole church and on all who heard about these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now many signs and wonders were being performed among the people through the hands of the apostles. And they were all together in Solomon’s Portico.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And none of the rest dared to join them, but the people spoke highly of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even more believers in the Lord were being added, large numbers of both men and women,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they even carried out the sick into the streets and put them on cots and mats so that when Peter came by, at least his shadow would fall on some of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people of the towns around Jerusalem also came together, bringing the sick and those tormented by unclean spirits, who were all being healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the high priest rose up and all those who were with him (that is, the party of the Sadducees), and they were filled with jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they laid hands on the apostles and put them in the public prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the prison and led them out and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and stand in the temple courts and proclaim to the people all the words of this life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when they heard this, they entered at daybreak into the temple courts and began teaching.
Now when the high priest and those with him arrived, they summoned the Sanhedrin—even the whole council of elders of the sons of Israel—and sent to the prison to have them brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the officers who came did not find them in the prison, and they returned and reported,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “We found the prison locked with all security and the guards standing at the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when both the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these words, they were greatly perplexed concerning them, as to what this might be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But someone came and reported to them, “Behold, the men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple courts and teaching the people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the captain went with the officers and brought them, not with force (for they were afraid of the people, lest they be stoned by them).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought them, they made them stand in the Sanhedrin, and the high priest put a question to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “We strictly commanded you not to teach in this name? And behold, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching! And you are intending to bring upon us the blood of this man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter and the apostles answered and said, “It is necessary to obey God rather than men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed by hanging him on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one God has exalted to his right hand as Leader and Savior to grant repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard this, they were infuriated, and were wanting to execute them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a certain man stood up in the Sanhedrin, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law respected by all the people, and gave orders to put the men outside for a short time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Men and Israelites, take care for yourselves what you are about to do to these men!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For before these days, Theudas rose up saying he was somebody. A number of men, about four hundred, joined him. He was executed, and all who followed him were dispersed and came to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this man, Judas the Galilean rose up in the days of the census and caused people to follow him in revolt. And that one perished, and all who followed him were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I tell you, keep away from these men, and leave them alone, because if this plan or this matter is from people, it will be overthrown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is from God, you will not be able to overthrow them, lest you even be found fighting against God.” So they were persuaded by him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they summoned the apostles, beat them, commanded them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and released them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went out from the presence of the Sanhedrin rejoicing, because they had been considered worthy to be dishonored for the sake of the name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every day, both in the temple courts and from house to house, they did not stop teaching and proclaiming the good news that the Christ was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in these days, as the disciples were increasing in number, a complaint arose by the Greek-speaking Jews against the Hebraic Jews because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the twelve summoned the community of disciples and said, “It is not desirable that we neglect the word of God to serve tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, brothers, select from among you seven men of good reputation, full of the Spirit and wisdom, whom we will put in charge of this need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the statement pleased the whole group, and they chose Stephen (a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit), and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolaus (a convert from Antioch),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom they stood before the apostles. And they prayed and placed their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of God kept spreading, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem was increasing greatly, and a large number of priests began obeying the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Stephen, full of grace and power, was performing great wonders and signs among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of those from the Synagogue of the Freedmen (as it was called), both Cyrenians and Alexandrians, and those from Cilicia and Asia, stood up and disputed with Stephen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit with which he was speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they secretly instigated men who said, “We have heard him speaking blasphemous words against Moses and God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they incited the people and the elders and the scribes, and they came up and seized him and brought him to the Sanhedrin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put forward false witnesses who said, “This man does not stop speaking words against the holy place and the law!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have heard him saying that this Nazarene Jesus will destroy this place and will change the customs that Moses handed down to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they looked intently at him, all those who were sitting in the Sanhedrin saw his face was like the face of an angel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the high priest said, “Is it so concerning these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Men—brothers and fathers—listen: The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham while he was in Mesopotamia, before he settled in Haran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, ‘Go out from your land and from your relatives and come to the land that I will show you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went out from the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. And from there, after his father died, he caused him to move to this land in which you now live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he did not give him an inheritance in it—not even a footstep—and he promised to give it to him for his possession, and to his descendants after him, although he did not have a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God spoke like this: ‘His descendants will be foreigners in a foreign land, and they will enslave them and mistreat them four hundred years,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the nation that they will serve as slaves, I will judge,’ God said, ‘and after these things they will come out and will worship me in this place.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision, and so he became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day, and Isaac did so with Jacob, and Jacob did so with the twelve patriarchs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the patriarchs, because they were jealous of Joseph, sold him into Egypt. And God was with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and rescued him from all his afflictions and granted him favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt. And he appointed him ruler over Egypt and all his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a famine came over all Egypt and Canaan and great affliction, and our fathers could not find food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Jacob heard there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the second visit Joseph was made known to his brothers, and the family of Joseph became known to Pharaoh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joseph sent and summoned his father Jacob and all his relatives, seventy-five persons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jacob went down to Egypt and died, he and our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were brought back to Shechem and buried in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a sum of silver from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But as the time of the promise that God had made to Abraham was drawing near, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: until another king arose over Egypt who did not know Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man deceitfully took advantage of our people and mistreated our ancestors, causing them to abandon their infants so that they would not be kept alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this time Moses was born, and he was beautiful to God. He was brought up for three months in his father’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when he was abandoned, the daughter of Pharaoh took him up and brought him up as her own son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was powerful in his words and deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when he was forty years old, it entered in his heart to visit his brothers, the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw one of them being unjustly harmed, he defended him and avenged the one who had been oppressed by striking down the Egyptian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he thought his brothers would understand that God was granting deliverance to them by his hand, but they did not understand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the following day, he made an appearance to them while they were fighting and was attempting to reconcile them in peace, saying, ‘Men and brothers, why are you doing wrong to one another?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who was doing wrong to his neighbor pushed him aside, saying, ‘Who appointed you a ruler and a judge over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not want to do away with me the same way you did away with the Egyptian yesterday, do you?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And at this statement, Moses fled and became a foreigner in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And when forty years had been completed, an angel appeared to him in the desert of Mount Sinai in the flame of a burning bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses saw it, he was astonished at the sight, and when he approached to look at it, the voice of the Lord came:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob!’ So Moses began trembling and did not dare to look at it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, ‘Untie the sandals from your feet, for the place on which you are standing is holy ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have certainly seen the mistreatment of my people who are in Egypt and have heard their groaning, and I have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send you to Egypt.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Moses whom they had repudiated, saying, ‘Who appointed you a ruler and a judge?’—this man God sent as both ruler and redeemer with the help of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man led them out, performing wonders and signs in the land of Egypt and at the Red Sea and in the wilderness for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the one who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him at Mount Sinai, and who with our fathers received living oracles to give to us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom our fathers were not willing to become obedient, but rejected him and turned back in their hearts to Egypt,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying to Aaron, ‘Make us gods who will go on before us! For this Moses, who led us out from the land of Egypt—we do not know what has happened to him!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they manufactured a calf in those days, and offered up a sacrifice to the idol, and began rejoicing in the works of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But God turned away and gave them over to worship the host of heaven, just as it is written in the book of the prophets:
‘You did not bring offerings and sacrifices to me
    for forty years in the wilderness, did you, house of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you took along the tabernacle of Moloch
    and the star of the god Rephan,
the images that you made, to worship them,
    and I will deport you beyond Babylon!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tabernacle of the testimony belonged to our fathers in the wilderness, just as the one who spoke to Moses directed him to make it according to the design that he had seen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and which, after receiving it in turn, our fathers brought in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations that God drove out from the presence of our fathers, until the days of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who found favor in the sight of God and asked to find a habitation for the God of Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Solomon built a house for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands, just as the prophet says,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Heaven is my throne
    and earth is the footstool for my feet.
What kind of house will you build for me, says the Lord,
    or what is the place of my rest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did not my hand make all these things?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You stiff-necked people and uncircumcised in hearts and in your ears! You constantly resist the Holy Spirit! As your fathers did, so also do you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they killed those who announced beforehand about the coming of the Righteous One, whose betrayers and murderers you have now become,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you who received the law by directions of angels and have not observed it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard these things, they were infuriated in their hearts and gnashed their teeth at him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, looked intently into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Behold, I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But crying out with a loud voice, they stopped their ears and rushed at him with one purpose.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had driven him out of the city, they began to stone him, and the witnesses laid aside their cloaks at the feet of a young man named Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they kept on stoning Stephen as he was calling out and saying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And falling to his knees, he cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them!” And after he said this, he fell asleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Saul was agreeing with his murder. Now there happened on that day a great persecution against the church in Jerusalem, and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And devout men buried Stephen and made loud lamentation over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul was attempting to destroy the church. Entering house after house, he dragged off both men and women and delivered them to prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who had been scattered went about proclaiming the good news of the word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Philip came down to the city of Samaria and began proclaiming the Christ to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowds with one mind were paying attention to what was being said by Philip, as they heard him and saw the signs that he was performing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many of those who had unclean spirits, they were coming out of them, crying out with a loud voice, and many who were paralyzed and lame were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was great joy in that city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man named Simon had been in the city practicing magic and astonishing the people of Samaria, saying he was someone great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were all paying attention to him, from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is the power of God that is called ‘Great.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they were paying attention to him because for a long time he had astonished them with his magic.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they believed Philip as he was proclaiming the good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, both men and women were being baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Simon himself also believed, and after he was baptized he was keeping close company with Philip. And when he saw the signs and great miracles that were taking place, he was astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who went down and prayed for them so that they would receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For he had not yet fallen on any of them, but they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they placed their hands on them and they received the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Simon, when he saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, offered them money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Give to me also this power, so that whomever I place my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said to him, “May your silver be destroyed along with you, because you thought you could acquire the gift of God by means of money!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have no part or share in this matter, because your heart is not right before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore repent of this wickedness of yours, and ask the Lord if perhaps the intent of your heart may be forgiven you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I see you are in a state of bitter envy and bound by unrighteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Simon answered and said, “You pray to the Lord for me so that nothing of what you have said will come upon me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they had solemnly testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they turned back toward Jerusalem, and were proclaiming the good news to many villages of the Samaritans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, “Get up and go toward the south on the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” (This is a desert road.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he got up and went, and behold, there was a man, an Ethiopian eunuch (a court official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasury) who had come to worship in Jerusalem
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and was returning and sitting in his chariot, and reading aloud the prophet Isaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit said to Philip, “Approach and join this chariot.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Philip ran up to it and heard him reading aloud Isaiah the prophet and said, “So then, do you understand what you are reading?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “So how could I, unless someone will guide me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the passage of scripture that he was reading aloud was this:
“He was led like a sheep to the slaughter,
    and like a lamb before its shearer is silent,
so he did not open his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his humiliation justice was taken from him.
Who can describe his descendants?
    For his life was taken away from the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the eunuch answered and said to Philip, “I ask you, about whom does the prophet say this—about himself or about someone else?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Philip opened his mouth and beginning from this scripture, proclaimed the good news to him about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were traveling down the road, they came to some water. And the eunuch said, “Look! Water! What prevents me from being baptized?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he ordered the chariot to stop, and they both went down into the water—Philip and the eunuch—and he baptized him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord carried Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him any longer, for he went on his way rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Philip found himself at Azotus, and as he passed through, he proclaimed the good news to all the towns until he came to Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and asked for letters from him to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any who were of the Way, both men and women, he could bring them tied up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as he proceeded, it happened that when he approached Damascus, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And falling to the ground, he heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Who are you, Lord?” And he said, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But get up and enter into the city, and it will be told to you what you must do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the men who were traveling together with him stood speechless, because they heard the voice but saw no one.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul got up from the ground, but although his eyes were open he could see nothing. And leading him by the hand, they brought him into Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was unable to see for three days, and he did not eat or drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a certain disciple in Damascus named Ananias, and the Lord said to him in a vision, “Ananias!” And he said, “Behold, here I am, Lord!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “Get up, go to the street called ‘Straight’ and in the house of Judas look for a man named Saul from Tarsus. For behold, he is praying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in and placing hands on him so that he may regain his sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Ananias replied, “Lord, I have heard from many people about this man, how much harm he has done to your saints in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and here he has authority from the chief priests to tie up all who call upon your name!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to him, “Go, because this man is my chosen instrument to carry my name before Gentiles and kings and the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ananias departed and entered into the house, and placing his hands on him, he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road by which you came, has sent me so that you may regain your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately something like scales fell from his eyes and he regained his sight and got up and was baptized,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after taking food, he regained his strength. And he was with the disciples in Damascus several days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately he began proclaiming Jesus in the synagogues: “This one is the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who heard him were amazed, and were saying, “Is this not the one who was wreaking havoc in Jerusalem on those who call upon this name, and had come here for this reason, that he could bring them tied up to the chief priests?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul was increasing in strength even more, and was confounding the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that this one is the Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when many days had elapsed, the Jews plotted to do away with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But their plot became known to Saul, and they were also watching the gates both day and night so that they could do away with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his disciples took him at night and let him down through the wall by lowering him in a basket.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he arrived in Jerusalem, he was attempting to associate with the disciples, and they were all afraid of him, because they did not believe that he was a disciple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles and related to them how he had seen the Lord on the road and that he had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had spoken boldly in the name of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was going in and going out among them in Jerusalem, speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he was speaking and debating with the Greek-speaking Jews, but they were trying to do away with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the brothers found out, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the church throughout all of Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace, being strengthened. And living in the fear of the Lord and the encouragement of the Holy Spirit, it was increasing in numbers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that as Peter was traveling through all the places, he also came down to the saints who lived in Lydda.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he found there a certain man named Aeneas who was paralyzed, who had been lying on a mat for eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you! Get up and make your bed yourself!” And immediately he got up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him, who all indeed turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in Joppa there was a certain female disciple named Tabitha (which translated means “Dorcas”). She was full of good deeds and charitable giving which she was constantly doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that in those days after becoming sick, she died. And after washing her, they placed her in an upstairs room.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, when they heard that Peter was in Lydda, sent two men to him, urging, “Do not delay to come to us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter got up and accompanied them. When he arrived, they brought him up to the upstairs room, and all the widows came to him, weeping and showing him tunics and other clothing that Dorcas used to make while she was with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter sent them all outside, and, falling to his knees, he prayed. And turning toward the body, he said, “Tabitha, get up!” And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter, she sat up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he gave her his hand and raised her up. And he called the saints and the widows and presented her alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it became known throughout all Joppa, and many believed in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that he stayed many days in Joppa with a certain Simon, a tanner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there was a certain man in Caesarea named Cornelius, a centurion of what was called the Italian Cohort,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: devout and fearing God together with all his household, doing many charitable deeds for the people and praying to God continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About the ninth hour of the day, he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God coming to him and saying to him, “Cornelius.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stared at him and became terrified and said, “What is it, Lord?” And he said to him, “Your prayers and your charitable deeds have gone up for a memorial offering before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, send men to Joppa and summon a certain Simon, who is also called Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man is staying as a guest with a certain Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the angel who spoke to him departed, he summoned two of the household slaves and a devout soldier from those who attended him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and after he had explained everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next day, as they were on their way and approaching the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray at about the sixth hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he became hungry and wanted to eat. But while they were preparing the food, a trance came over him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he saw heaven opened and an object something like a large sheet coming down, being let down to the earth by its four corners,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which were all the four-footed animals and reptiles of the earth and birds of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came to him, “Get up, Peter, slaughter and eat!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter said, “Certainly not, Lord! For I have never eaten anything common and unclean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the voice came again to him for the second time: “The things which God has made clean, you must not consider unclean!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this happened three times, and immediately the object was taken up into heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Peter was greatly perplexed within himself as to what the vision that he had seen might be, behold, the men who had been sent by Cornelius, having found the house of Simon by asking around, stood at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they called out and asked if Simon who was also called Peter was staying there as a guest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while Peter was reflecting about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, men are looking for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But get up, go down, and go with them—not hesitating at all, because I have sent them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter went down to the men and said, “Behold, I am he whom you are looking for! What is the reason for which you have come?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous and God-fearing man—and well spoken of by the whole nation of the Jews—was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house and to hear words from you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he invited them in and entertained them as guests, and on the next day he got up and went away with them. And some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And on the next day he entered into Caesarea.
Now Cornelius was waiting for them, and had called together his relatives and close friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it happened that when Peter entered, Cornelius met him, fell at his feet, and worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter helped him up, saying, “Get up! I myself am also a man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he conversed with him, he went in and found many people gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “You know that it is forbidden for a Jewish man to associate with or to approach a foreigner. And to me God has shown that I should call no man common or unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore—and without raising any objection—I came when I was sent for. So I ask for what reason you sent for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Cornelius said, “Four days ago at this hour, the ninth, I was praying in my house. And behold, a man in shining clothing stood before me
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your charitable deeds have been remembered before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore send to Joppa and summon Simon who is also called Peter. This man is staying as a guest in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I sent for you at once, and you were kind enough to come. So now we all are present before God to hear all the things that have been commanded to you by the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Peter opened his mouth and said, “In truth I understand that God is not one who shows partiality,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in every nation the one who fears him and who does what is right is acceptable to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the message that he sent to the sons of Israel, proclaiming the good news of peace through Jesus Christ—this one is Lord of all—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you know the thing that happened throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee, after the baptism that John proclaimed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus of Nazareth—how God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, because God was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are witnesses of all the things that he did both in the land of the Judeans and in Jerusalem, whom they also executed by hanging him on a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God raised this one up on the third day and granted that he should become visible,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to all the people but to us who had been chosen beforehand by God as witnesses, who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he commanded us to preach to the people and to testify solemnly that this one is the one appointed by God as judge of the living and of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To this one all the prophets testify, that through his name everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell on all those who were listening to the message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those believers from the circumcision who had accompanied Peter were astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they heard them speaking in tongues and glorifying God. Then Peter said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Surely no one can withhold the water for these people to be baptized, who have received the Holy Spirit as we also did!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay for several days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the apostles and the brothers who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had accepted the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, those of the circumcision took issue with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “You went to men who were uncircumcised and ate with them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter began and explained it to them in an orderly sequence, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision—an object something like a large sheet coming down, being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I looked intently into it, I was considering it, and I saw the four-footed animals of the earth and the wild animals and the reptiles and the birds of the sky.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I also heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter, slaughter and eat!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said, ‘Certainly not, Lord! For nothing common or unclean has ever entered into my mouth!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the voice replied from heaven for the second time, ‘The things which God has made clean, you must not consider unclean!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this happened three times, and everything was pulled up into heaven again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, at once three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea approached the house in which we were staying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit told me to accompany them, not hesitating at all. So these six brothers also went with me, and we entered into the man’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he reported to us how he had seen the angel standing in his house and saying, ‘Send to Joppa and summon Simon, who is also called Peter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will speak words to you by which you will be saved, you and all your household.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I was beginning to speak, the Holy Spirit fell on them, just as also on us at the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if God gave them the same gift as also to us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to be able to hinder God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard these things, they became silent and praised God, saying, “Then God has granted the repentance leading to life to the Gentiles also!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who had been scattered because of the persecution that took place over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, proclaiming the message to no one except Jews alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them were men from Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they came to Antioch, began to speak to the Hellenists also, proclaiming the good news about the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a large number who believed turned to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the report came to the attention of the church that was in Jerusalem about them, and they sent out Barnabas as far as Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when he arrived and saw the grace of God, rejoiced and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with devoted hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a large number were added to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he departed for Tarsus to look for Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. And it happened to them also that they met together for a whole year with the church and taught a large number of people. And in Antioch the disciples were first called Christians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in those days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one of them named Agabus stood up and indicated by the Spirit that a great famine was about to come over the whole inhabited earth (which took place in the time of Claudius).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from the disciples, according to their ability to give, each one of them determined to send financial aid for support to the brothers who lived in Judea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which they also did, sending the aid to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at that time, Herod the king laid hands on some of those from the church to harm them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he executed James the brother of John with a sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he saw that it was pleasing to the Jews, he proceeded to arrest Peter also. (Now this was during the feast of Unleavened Bread.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he had arrested him, he also put him in prison, handing him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, intending to bring him out for public trial after the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Peter was kept in the prison, but prayer was fervently being made to God by the church for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Herod was about to bring him out, on that very night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and guards before the door were watching the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, an angel of the Lord stood near him, and a light shone in the prison cell. And striking Peter’s side, he woke him up, saying, “Get up quickly!” And his chains fell off of his hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel said to him, “Gird yourself and put on your sandals!” And he did so. And he said to him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went out and was following him. And he did not know that what was being done by the angel was real, but was thinking he was seeing a vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had passed the first and second guard, they came to the iron gate that leads to the city, which opened for them by itself, and they went out and went forward along one narrow street, and at once the angel departed from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Peter came to himself, he said, “Now I know truly that the Lord has sent out his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and all that the Jewish people expected!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he realized this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John (who is also called Mark), where many people were gathered together and were praying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he knocked at the door of the gateway, a female slave named Rhoda came up to answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And recognizing Peter’s voice, because of her joy she did not open the gate, but ran in and announced that Peter was standing at the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they said to her, “You are out of your mind!” But she kept insisting it was so. And they kept saying, “It is his angel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter was continuing to knock, and when they opened the door they saw him and were astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But motioning to them with his hand to be silent, he related to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, “Report these things to James and to the brothers,” and he departed and went to another place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when day came, there was not a little commotion among the soldiers as to what then had become of Peter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Herod had searched for him and did not find him, he questioned the guards and ordered that they be led away to execution. And he came down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he was very angry with the Tyrians and Sidonians. So they came to him with one purpose, and after persuading Blastus, the king’s chamberlain, they asked for peace, because their country was supported with food from the king’s country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on an appointed day Herod, after putting on royal clothing and sitting down on the judgment seat, began to deliver a public address to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people began to call out loudly, “The voice of a god and not of a man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down because he did not give the glory to God. And he was eaten by worms and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the word of God kept on increasing and multiplying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem when they had completed their service, having taken along with them John (who is also called Mark).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were prophets and teachers in Antioch in the church that was there: Barnabas, and Simeon (who was called Niger), and Lucius the Cyrenian, and Manaen (a close friend of Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were serving the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart now for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, after they had fasted and prayed and placed their hands on them, they sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, sent out by the Holy Spirit, they came down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed away to Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Salamis, they began to proclaim the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they also had John as assistant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had crossed over the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a certain man, a magician, a Jewish false prophet whose name was Bar-Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. This man summoned Barnabas and Saul and wished to hear the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Elymas the magician (for his name is translated in this way) opposed them, attempting to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Saul (also called Paul), filled with the Holy Spirit, looked intently at him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “O you who are full of all deceit and of all unscrupulousness, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness! Will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now behold, the hand of the Lord is against you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun for a while. And immediately mist and darkness fell over him, and he was going around looking for people to lead him by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, because he was astounded at the teaching about the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Paul and his companions put out to sea from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia, but John departed from them and returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went on from Perga and arrived at Pisidian Antioch. And they entered into the synagogue on the day of the Sabbath and sat down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after the reading from the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent word to them, saying, “Men and brothers, if there is any message of exhortation by you for the people, say it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand, he said, “Israelite men, and those who fear God, listen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and exalted the people during their stay in the land of Egypt, and with uplifted arm he led them out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for a period of time of about forty years, he put up with them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after destroying seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave their land to his people as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This took about four hundred and fifty years. And after these things, he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And then they asked for a king, and God gave them Saul son of Kish, a man from the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after removing him, he raised up David for their king, about whom he also said, testifying, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse to be a man in accordance with my heart, who will carry out all my will.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the descendants of this man, according to his promise, God brought to Israel a Savior, Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before his coming John had publicly proclaimed a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while John was completing his mission, he said, ‘What do you suppose me to be? I am not he! But behold, one is coming after me of whom I am not worthy to untie the sandals of his feet!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men and brothers, sons of the family of Abraham and those among you who fear God—to us the message of this salvation has been sent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For those who live in Jerusalem and their rulers, because they did not recognize this one, and the voices of the prophets that are read on every Sabbath, fulfilled them by condemning him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although they found no charge worthy of death, they asked Pilate that he be executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had carried out all the things that were written about him, they took him down from the tree and placed him in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God raised him from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who appeared for many days to those who had come up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem—who are now his witnesses to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we proclaim the good news to you: that the promise that was made to the fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: But that he has raised him from the dead, no more going to return to decay, he has spoken in this way: ‘I will give you the reliable divine decrees of David.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore he also says in another psalm,
‘You will not permit your Holy One to experience decay.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David, after serving the purpose of God in his own generation, fell asleep and was buried with his fathers, and experienced decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he whom God raised up did not experience decay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore let it be known to you, men and brothers, that through this one forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you, and from all the things from which you were not able to be justified by the law of Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by this one everyone who believes is justified!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Watch out, therefore, lest what is stated by the prophets come upon you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Look, you scoffers,
    and be astonished and perish!
    For I am doing a work in your days,
    a work that you would never believe
        even if someone were to tell it to you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator
