verses.text: And as they were going out, they began urging that these things be spoken about to them on the next Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the synagogue had broken up, many of the Jews and the devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who were speaking to them and were persuading them to continue in the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the coming Sabbath, nearly the whole city came together to hear the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy, and began contradicting what was being said by Paul by reviling him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both Paul and Barnabas spoke boldly and said, “It was necessary that the word of God be spoken first to you, since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life! Behold, we are turning to the Gentiles!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For so the Lord has commanded us:
‘I have appointed you to be a light for the Gentiles,
    that you would bring salvation to the end of the earth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Gentiles heard this, they began to rejoice and to glorify the word of the Lord. And all those who were designated for eternal life believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the word of the Lord was carried through the whole region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews incited the devout women of high social standing and the most prominent men of the city, and stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and threw them out of their district.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after shaking off the dust from their feet against them, they went to Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened that in Iconium they entered together into the synagogue of the Jews and spoke in such a way that a large number of both Jews and Greeks believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews who were disobedient stirred up and poisoned the minds of the Gentiles against the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they stayed there for a considerable time, speaking boldly for the Lord, who testified to the message of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be performed through their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the population of the city was divided, and some were with the Jews and some with the apostles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when an inclination took place on the part of both the Gentiles and the Jews, together with their rulers, to mistreat them and to stone them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they became aware of it and fled to the Lycaonian cities—Lystra and Derbe and the surrounding region.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there they were continuing to proclaim the good news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in Lystra a certain man was sitting powerless in his feet, lame from birth, who had never walked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man listened while Paul was speaking. Paul, looking intently at him and seeing that he had faith to be healed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: said with a loud voice, “Stand upright on your feet!” And he leaped up and began walking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the crowds saw what Paul had done, they raised their voices in the Lycaonian language, saying, “The gods have become like men and have come down to us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they began calling Barnabas Zeus and Paul Hermes, because he was the principal speaker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest of the temple of Zeus that was just outside the city brought bulls and garlands to the gates and was wanting to offer sacrifice, along with the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard about it, they tore their clothing and rushed out into the crowd, shouting
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men with the same nature as you, proclaiming the good news that you should turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all the things that are in them—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who in generations that are past permitted all the nations to go their own ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And yet he did not leave himself without witness by doing good, giving you rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, satisfying you with food and your hearts with gladness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And although they said these things, only with difficulty did they dissuade the crowds from offering sacrifice to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jews arrived from Antioch and Iconium, and when they had won over the crowds and stoned Paul, they dragged him outside the city, thinking he was dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after the disciples surrounded him, he got up and went into the city. And on the next day he departed with Barnabas for Derbe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had proclaimed the good news in that city and made many disciples, they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthening the souls of the disciples, encouraging them to continue in the faith and saying, “Through many persecutions it is necessary for us to enter into the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had appointed elders for them in every church, after praying with fasting, they entrusted them to the Lord, in whom they had believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they passed through Pisidia and came to Pamphylia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they proclaimed the message in Perga, they went down to Attalia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from there they sailed away to Antioch where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work that they had completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they arrived and called the church together, they reported all that God had done with them, and that he had opened a door of faith for the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stayed no little time with the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some men came down from Judea and began teaching the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom prescribed by Moses, you cannot be saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after there was no little strife and debate by Paul and Barnabas against them, they appointed Paul and Barnabas and some others from among them to go up to the apostles and elders in Jerusalem concerning this issue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were sent on their way by the church, and passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria, telling in detail the conversion of the Gentiles and bringing great joy to all the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they arrived in Jerusalem, they were received by the church and the apostles and the elders, and reported all that God had done with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of those who had believed from the party of the Pharisees stood up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them and to command them to observe the law of Moses!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both the apostles and the elders assembled to deliberate concerning this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after there was much debate, Peter stood up and said to them, “Men and brothers, you know that in the early days God chose among you through my mouth that the Gentiles should hear the message of the gospel and believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God, who knows the heart, testified to them by giving them the Holy Spirit, just as he also did to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made no distinction between us and them, cleansing their hearts by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now why are you putting God to the test by placing on the neck of the disciples a yoke that neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we believe we will be saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus in the same way those also are.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole group became silent and listened to Barnabas and Paul describing all the signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had stopped speaking, James answered, saying, “Men and brothers, listen to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon has described how God first concerned himself to take from among the Gentiles a people for his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with this the words of the prophets agree, just as it is written:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘After these things I will return
    and build up again the tent of David that has fallen,
    and the parts of it that had been torn down I will build up again
    and will restore it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that the rest of humanity may seek the Lord,
    even all the Gentiles who are called by my name,
    says the Lord, who makes these things
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: known from of old.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I conclude we should not cause difficulty for those from among the Gentiles who turn to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we should write a letter to them to abstain from the pollution of idols and from sexual immorality and from what has been strangled and from blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Moses has those who proclaim him in every city from ancient generations, because he is read aloud in the synagogues on every Sabbath.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it seemed best to the apostles and the elders, together with the whole church, to send men chosen from among them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas—Judas who was called Barsabbas and Silas, men who were leaders among the brothers—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
writing this letter to be delivered by them:
The apostles and the elders, brothers.
To the brothers who are from among the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia.
Greetings!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because we have heard that some have gone out from among us—to whom we gave no orders—and have thrown you into confusion by words upsetting your minds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: it seemed best to us, having reached a unanimous decision, and having chosen men, to send them to you together with our dear friends Barnabas and Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: men who have risked their lives on behalf of the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore we have sent Judas and Silas, and they will report the same things by word of mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it seemed best to the Holy Spirit and to us to place on you no greater burden except these necessary things:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you abstain from food sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what has been strangled, and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from these things you will do well.
Farewell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when they were sent off, they came down to Antioch, and after calling together the community, they delivered the letter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they read it aloud, they rejoiced at the encouragement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both Judas and Silas, who were also prophets themselves, encouraged and strengthened the brothers by a long message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after spending some time, they were sent away in peace from the brothers to those who had sent them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch teaching and proclaiming the word of the Lord with many others also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after some days, Paul said to Barnabas, “Come then,let us return and visit the brothers in every town in which we proclaimed the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Barnabas wanted to take John who was called Mark along also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Paul held the opinion they should not take this one along, who departed from them in Pamphylia and did not accompany them in the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a sharp disagreement took place, so that they separated from one another. And Barnabas took along Mark and sailed away to Cyprus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but Paul chose Silas and departed, after being commended to the grace of the Lord by the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he traveled through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came also to Derbe and to Lystra. And behold, a certain disciple was there named Timothy, the son of a believing Jewish woman but of a Greek father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was well spoken of by the brothers in Lystra and Iconium.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Paul wanted this one to go with him, and he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those places, for they all knew that his father was Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they went through the towns, they passed on to them to observe the rules that had been decided by the apostles and elders who were in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the churches were being strengthened in the faith and were growing in number every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they traveled through the Phrygian and Galatian region, having been prevented by the Holy Spirit from speaking the message in Asia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to Mysia, they attempted to go into Bithynia, and the Spirit of Jesus did not permit them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So going through Mysia, they went down to Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a vision appeared to Paul during the night: a certain Macedonian man was standing there and imploring him and saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had seen the vision, we wanted at once to go away to Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to proclaim the good news to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So putting out to sea from Troas, we sailed a straight course to Samothrace, and on the following day to Neapolis,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from there to Philippi, which is a leading city of that district of Macedonia, a Roman colony. And we were staying in this city for some days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the day of the Sabbath, we went outside the city gate beside the river, where we thought there was a place of prayer, and we sat down and spoke to the women assembled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain woman named Lydia from the city of Thyatira, a merchant dealing in purple cloth who showed reverence for God, was listening. The Lord opened her heart to pay attention to what was being said by Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after she was baptized, and her household, she urged us, saying, “If you consider me to be a believer in the Lord, come to my house and stay.” And she prevailed upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that as we were going to the place of prayer, a certain female slave who had a spirit of divination met us, who was bringing a large profit to her owners by fortune-telling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She followed Paul and us and was crying out, saying, “These men are slaves of the Most High God, who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she was doing this for many days. But Paul, becoming greatly annoyed and turning around, said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her!” And it came out immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when her owners saw that their hope of profit was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they had brought them to the chief magistrates, they said, “These men are throwing our city into confusion, being Jews,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and are proclaiming customs that are not permitted for us to accept or to practice, because we are Romans!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the crowd joined in attacking them, and the chief magistrates tore off their clothing and gave orders to beat them with rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after they had inflicted many blows on them, they threw them into prison, giving orders to the jailer to guard them securely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having received such an order, he put them in the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now about midnight, Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken. And immediately all the doors were opened and all the bonds were unfastened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after the jailer was awake and saw the doors of the prison open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, because he thought the prisoners had escaped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul called out with a loud voice, saying, “Do no harm to yourself, for we are all here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And demanding lights, he rushed in and, beginning to tremble, fell down at the feet of Paul and Silas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought them outside and said, “Sirs, what must I do so that I can be saved?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said, “Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved, you and your household!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they spoke the message of the Lord to him, together with all those in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took them at that very hour of the night and washed their wounds, and he himself was baptized at once, and all those of his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought them up into his house and set a meal before them, and rejoiced greatly that he had believed in God with his whole household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was day, the chief magistrates sent the police officers, saying, “Release those men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the jailer reported these words to Paul: “The chief magistrates have sent an order that you should be released. So come out now and go in peace!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said to them, “They beat us in public without due process—men who are Roman citizens—and threw us into prison, and now they are wanting to release us secretly? Certainly not! Rather let them come themselves and bring us out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the police officers reported these words to the chief magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Roman citizens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came and apologized to them, and after they brought them out they asked them to depart from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came out of the prison, they went to Lydia and when they saw them, they encouraged the brothers and departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after they traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as was his custom, Paul went in to them and on three Sabbath days he discussed with them from the scriptures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: explaining and demonstrating that it was necessary for the Christ to suffer and to rise from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus whom I am proclaiming to you is the Christ.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of them were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, and also a large number of God-fearing Greeks and not a few of the prominent women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jews were filled with jealousy and, taking along some worthless men from the rabble in the marketplace and forming a mob, threw the city into an uproar. And attacking Jason’s house, they were looking for them to bring them out to the popular assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they did not find them, they dragged Jason and some brothers before the city officials, shouting, “These people who have stirred up trouble throughout the world have come here also,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom Jason has entertained as guests! And these people are all acting contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying there is another king, Jesus!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they threw the crowd into confusion, and the city officials who heard these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after taking money as security from Jason and the rest, they released them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the brothers sent away both Paul and Silas at once, during the night, to Berea. They went into the synagogue of the Jews when they arrived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica. They accepted the message with all eagerness, examining the scriptures every day to see if these things were so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore many of them believed, and not a few of the prominent Greek women and men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Jews from Thessalonica found out that the message of God had been proclaimed by Paul in Berea also, they came there too, inciting and stirring up the crowds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then the brothers sent Paul away at once to go to the sea, and both Silas and Timothy remained there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who conducted Paul brought him as far as Athens, and after receiving an order for Silas and Timothy that they should come to him as soon as possible, they went away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now while Paul was waiting for them in Athens, his spirit was provoked within him when he observed the city was full of idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he was discussing in the synagogue with the Jews and the God-fearing Gentiles, and in the marketplace every day with those who happened to be there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were conversing with him, and some were saying, “What does this babbler want to say?” But others said, “He appears to be a proclaimer of foreign deities,” because he was proclaiming the good news about Jesus and the resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took hold of him and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, “May we learn what is this new teaching being proclaimed by you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are bringing some astonishing things to our ears. Therefore we want to know what these things mean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now all the Athenians and the foreigners who stayed there used to spend their time in nothing else than telling something or listening to something new.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul stood there in the middle of the Areopagus and said, “Men of Athens, I see you are very religious in every respect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as I was passing through and observing carefully your objects of worship, I even found an altar on which was inscribed, ‘To an unknown God.’ Therefore what you worship without knowing it, this I proclaim to you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the God who made the world and all the things in it. This one, being Lord of heaven and earth, does not live in temples made by human hands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor is he served by human hands as if he needed anything, because he himself gives to everyone life and breath and everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he made from one man every nation of humanity to live on all the face of the earth, determining their fixed times and the fixed boundaries of their habitation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to search for God, if perhaps indeed they might feel around for him and find him. And indeed he is not far away from each one of us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for in him we live and move and exist, as even some of your own poets have said: ‘For we also are his offspring.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, because we are offspring of God, we ought not to think the divine being is like gold or silver or stone, an image formed by human skill and thought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore although God has overlooked the times of ignorance, he now commands all people everywhere to repent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he has set a day on which he is going to judge the world in righteousness by the man who he has appointed, having provided proof to everyone by raising him from the dead.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard about the resurrection of the dead, some scoffed, but others said, “We will hear you about this again also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul went out from the midst of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some people joined him and believed, among whom also were Dionysius the Areopagite and a woman named Damaris and others with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things he departed from Athens and went to Corinth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he found a certain Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus who had arrived recently from Italy along with Priscilla his wife, because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to depart from Rome, and he went to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he was practicing the same trade, he stayed with them and worked, for they were tentmakers by trade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he argued in the synagogue every Sabbath, attempting to persuade both Jews and Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when both Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul began to be occupied with the message, solemnly testifying to the Jews that the Christ was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they resisted and reviled him, he shook out his clothes and said to them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am guiltless! From now on I will go to the Gentiles!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And leaving there, he entered into the house of someone named Titius Justus, a worshiper of God whose house was next door to the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the Lord together with his whole household. And many of the Corinthians, when they heard about it, believed and were baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Paul by a vision in the night, “Do not be afraid, but speak and do not keep silent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I am with you and no one will attack you to harm you, because many people are mine in this city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he stayed a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews rose up with one purpose against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “This man is persuading people to worship God contrary to the law!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, “If it was some crime or wicked villainy, O Jews, I would have been justified in accepting your complaint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is questions concerning a word and names and your own law, see to it yourselves! I do not wish to be a judge of these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he drove them away from the judgment seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they all seized Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and began beating him in front of the judgment seat. And none of these things was a concern to Gallio.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul, after remaining many days longer, said farewell to the brothers and sailed away to Syria, and with him Priscilla and Aquila. He shaved his head at Cenchrea, because he had taken a vow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they arrived at Ephesus, and those he left behind there, but he himself entered into the synagogue and discussed with the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they asked him to stay for a longer time, he did not give his consent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but saying farewell and telling them, “I will return to you again if God wills,” he set sail from Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he arrived at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church, and went down to Antioch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after spending some time there, he departed, traveling through one place after another in the Galatian region and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, a native Alexandrian, arrived in Ephesus—an eloquent man who was well-versed in the scriptures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord, and being enthusiastic in spirit, he was speaking and teaching accurately the things about Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue, but when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside and explained the way of God to him more accurately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he wanted to cross over to Achaia, the brothers encouraged him and wrote to the disciples to welcome him. When he arrived, he assisted greatly those who had believed through grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he was vigorously refuting the Jews in public, demonstrating through the scriptures that the Christ was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that while Apollos was in Corinth, Paul traveled through the inland regions and came to Ephesus and found some disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?” And they said to him, “But we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “Into what then were you baptized?” And they said, “Into the baptism of John.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul said, “John baptized with a baptism of repentance, telling the people that they should believe in the one who was to come after him—that is, in Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Paul laid hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them and they began to speak in tongues and to prophesy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the total number of men was about twelve.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he entered into the synagogue and was speaking boldly for three months, discussing and attempting to convince them concerning the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when some became hardened and were disobedient, reviling the Way before the congregation, he departed from them and took away the disciples, leading discussions every day in the lecture hall of Tyrannus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this took place for two years, so that all who lived in Asia heard the word of the Lord, both Jews and Greeks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God was performing extraordinary miracles by the hands of Paul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that even handkerchiefs or work aprons that had touched his skin were carried away to those who were sick, and their diseases left them and the evil spirits came out of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some itinerant Jewish exorcists also attempted to pronounce the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits, saying, “I adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now seven sons of a certain Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, were doing this.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the evil spirit answered and said to them, “Jesus I know, and Paul I am acquainted with, but who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man who had the evil spirit leaped on them, subdued all of them, and prevailed against them, so that they ran away from that house naked and wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this became known to all who lived in Ephesus, both Jews and Greeks, and fear fell upon them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many of those who had believed came, confessing and disclosing their practices,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many of those who practiced magic brought together their books and burned them up in the sight of everyone. And they counted up their value and found it was fifty thousand silver coins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way the word of the Lord was growing in power and was prevailing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when these things were completed, Paul resolved in the Spirit to go to Jerusalem, passing through Macedonia and Achaia, saying, “After I have been there, it is necessary for me to see Rome also.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after sending two of those who were assisting him, Timothy and Erastus, to Macedonia, he himself stayed some time in Asia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there happened at that time no little disturbance concerning the Way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For someone named Demetrius, a silversmith who made silver replicas of the temple of Artemis, was bringing no little business to the craftsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These he gathered together, and the workers occupied with such things, and said, “Men, you know that from this business we get our prosperity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you see and hear that not only in Ephesus but in almost all of Asia this man Paul has persuaded and turned away a large crowd by saying that the gods made by hands are not gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So not only is there a danger this line of business of ours will come into disrepute, but also the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be regarded as nothing—and she is about to be brought down even from her grandeur, she whom the whole of Asia and the entire world worship!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this and became full of rage, they began to shout, saying, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the city was filled with the tumult, and with one purpose they rushed into the theater, seizing Gaius and Aristarchus, Macedonians who were traveling companions of Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul wanted to enter into the popular assembly, the disciples would not let him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even some of the Asiarchs who were his friends sent word to him and were urging him not to risk himself by going into the theater.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So some were shouting one thing and some another, for the assembly was in confusion, and the majority did not know why they had assembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the crowd advised Alexander, when the Jews put him forward. But Alexander, motioning with his hand, was wanting to defend himself to the popular assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they recognized that he was a Jew, they were shouting with one voice from all of them for about two hours, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the city secretary had quieted the crowd, he said, “Ephesian men, for who is there among men who does not know the Ephesian city is honorary temple keeper of the great Artemis and of her image fallen from heaven?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore because these things are undeniable, it is necessary that you be quiet and do nothing rash!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have brought these men here who are neither temple robbers nor blasphemers of our goddess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a complaint against anyone, the court days are observed and there are proconsuls—let them bring charges against one another!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you desire anything further, it will be settled in the lawful assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed we are in danger of being accused of rioting concerning today, since there is no cause in relation to which we will be able to give an account concerning this disorderly gathering!” And when he had said these things, he dismissed the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after the turmoil had ceased, Paul summoned the disciples, and after encouraging them, he said farewell and departed to travel to Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had gone through those regions and encouraged them at length, he came to Greece
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and stayed three months. Because a plot was made against him by the Jews as he was about to set sail for Syria, he came to a decision to return through Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea, and Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, and Gaius from Derbe, and Timothy, and Tychicus and Trophimus from Asia, were accompanying him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these had gone on ahead and were waiting for us in Troas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread and came to them at Troas within five days, where we stayed seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the first day of the week, when we had assembled to break bread, Paul began conversing with them, because he was going to leave on the next day, and he extended his message until midnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were quite a few lamps in the upstairs room where we were gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain young man named Eutychus who was sitting in the window was sinking into a deep sleep while Paul was conversing at length. Being overcome by sleep, he fell down from the third story and was picked up dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul went down and threw himself on him, and putting his arms around him, said, “Do not be distressed, for his life is in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went up and broke bread, and when he had eaten and talked for a long time, until dawn, then he departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they led the youth away alive, and were greatly comforted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we went on ahead to the ship and put out to sea for Assos, intending to take Paul on board there. For having made arrangements in this way, he himself was intending to travel by land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he met us at Assos, we took him on board and went to Mitylene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we sailed from there on the next day, and arrived opposite Chios. And on the next day we approached Samos, and on the following day we came to Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus so that he would not be having to spend time in Asia. For he was hurrying if it could be possible for him to be in Jerusalem on the day of Pentecost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Miletus he sent word to Ephesus and summoned the elders of the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they came to him, he said to them, “You know from the first day on which I set foot in Asia how I was the whole time with you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: serving the Lord with all humility and with tears, and with the trials that happened to me through the plots of the Jews—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how I did not shrink from proclaiming to you anything that would be profitable, and from teaching you in public and from house to house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: testifying both to Jews and to Greeks with respect to repentance toward God and faith in our Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now behold, bound by the Spirit I am traveling to Jerusalem, not knowing the things that will happen to me there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except that the Holy Spirit testifies to me in town after town, saying that bonds and persecutions await me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I consider my life as worth nothing to myself, in order to finish my mission and the ministry that I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the gospel of the grace of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now behold, I know that all of you, among whom I went about proclaiming the kingdom, will see my face no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I testify to you on this very day that I am guiltless of the blood of all of you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I did not shrink from proclaiming to you the whole purpose of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on guard for yourselves and for all the flock among which the Holy Spirit has appointed you as overseers, to shepherd the church of God which he obtained through the blood of his own Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that after my departure fierce wolves will come in among you, not sparing the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from among you yourselves men will arise, speaking perversions of the truth in order to draw away the disciples after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore be on the alert, remembering that night and day for three years I did not stop warning each one of you with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now I entrust you to God and to the message of his grace, which is able to build you up and to give you the inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have desired no one’s silver or gold or clothing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You yourselves know that these hands served to meet my needs and the needs of those who were with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have shown you with respect to all things that by working hard in this way it is necessary to help those who are in need, and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus that he himself said, “It is more blessed to give than to receive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had said these things, he fell to his knees and prayed with them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was considerable weeping by all, and hugging Paul, they kissed him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: especially distressed at the statement that he had said, that they were going to see his face no more. And they accompanied him to the ship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that after we tore ourselves away from them, we put out to sea, and running a straight course we came to Cos and on the next day to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And finding a ship that was crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard and put out to sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after we sighted Cyprus and left it behind on the port side, we sailed to Syria and arrived at Tyre, because the ship was to unload its cargo there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we stayed there seven days after we found the disciples, who kept telling Paul through the Spirit not to set foot in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it happened that when our days were over, we departed and went on our way, while all of them accompanied us, together with their wives and children, as far as outside the city. And after falling to our knees on the beach and praying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: we said farewell to one another and embarked in the ship, and they returned to their own homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had completed the voyage from Tyre, we arrived at Ptolemais. And after we greeted the brothers, we stayed one day with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the next day we departed and came to Caesarea, and entered into the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while we were staying there many days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came to us and took Paul’s belt. Tying up his own feet and hands, he said, “This is what the Holy Spirit says: ‘In this way the Jews in Jerusalem will tie up the man whose belt this is, and will deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we heard these things, both we and the local residents urged him not to go up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul replied, “What are you doing weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be tied up, but even to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because he would not be persuaded, we remained silent, saying, “The will of the Lord be done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after these days we got ready and went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the disciples from Caesarea also traveled together with us, bringing us to a certain Mnason of Cyprus, a disciple of long standing, with whom we were to be entertained as guests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we came to Jerusalem, the brothers welcomed us gladly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the next day Paul went in with us to James, and all the elders were present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after greeting them, he began to relate one after the other the things which God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard this, they began to glorify God. And they said to him, “You see, brother, how many ten thousands there are among the Jews who have believed, and they are all zealous adherents of the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have been informed about you that you are teaching all the Jews who are among the Gentiles the abandonment of Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children or to live according to our customs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then is to be done? Doubtless they will all hear that you have come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore do this that we tell you: we have four men who have taken a vow upon themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take these men and purify yourself along with them and pay their expenses so that they can shave their heads, and everyone will know that the things which they had been informed about you are nothing, but you yourself also agree with observing the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But concerning the Gentiles who have believed, we have written a letter after deciding they should avoid food sacrificed to idols and blood and what has been strangled and sexual immorality.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul took along the men on the next day, and after he had purified himself together with them, he entered into the temple courts, announcing the completion of the days of purification until the time the offering would be presented on behalf of each one of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the seven days were about to be completed, the Jews from Asia who had seen him in the temple courts stirred up the whole crowd and laid hands on him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: shouting, “Israelite men, help! This is the man who is teaching everyone everywhere against the people and the law and this place! And furthermore he also brought Greeks into the temple, and has defiled this holy place!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For they had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him, whom they thought that Paul had brought into the temple.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the whole city was stirred up, and the people came running together, and they seized Paul and dragged him outside of the temple courts, and immediately the doors were shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were seeking to kill him, a report came up to the military tribune of the cohort that all Jerusalem was in confusion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He immediately took along soldiers and centurions and ran down to them. And when they saw the military tribune and the soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the military tribune came up and arrested him and ordered him to be bound with two chains, and inquired who he was and what it was that he had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some in the crowd were shouting one thing and others another, and because he was not able to find out the truth on account of the commotion, he gave orders to bring him into the barracks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he came to the steps, it happened that he had to be carried by the soldiers on account of the violence of the crowd,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the crowd of people was following them, shouting, “Away with him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was about to be brought into the barracks, Paul said to the military tribune, “Is it permitted for me to say something to you?” And he said, “Do you know Greek?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you are not the Egyptian who before these days raised a revolt and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the Assassins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am a Jewish man from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no unimportant city. Now I ask you, allow me to speak to the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he permitted him, Paul, standing there on the steps, motioned with his hand to the people. And when there was a great silence, he addressed them in the Aramaic language, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Men—brothers and fathers—listen to my defense to you now!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they heard that he was addressing them in the Aramaic language, they became even more silent. And he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am a Jewish man born in Tarsus in Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, educated according to the exactness of the law received from our fathers, being zealous for God, just as all of you are today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I persecuted this Way to the death, tying up and delivering to prison both men and women,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as indeed the high priest and the whole council of elders can testify about me, from whom also I received letters to the brothers in Damascus, and was traveling there to lead away those who were there also tied up to Jerusalem so that they could be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it happened that as I was traveling and approaching Damascus around noon, suddenly a very bright light from heaven flashed around me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I answered, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ And he said to me, ‘I am Jesus the Nazarene whom you are persecuting.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now those who were with me saw the light but did not hear the voice of the one who was speaking to me.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I said, ‘What should I do, Lord?’ And the Lord said to me, ‘Get up and proceed to Damascus, and there it will be told to you about all the things that have been appointed for you to do.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as I could not see as a result of the brightness of that light, I arrived in Damascus led by the hand of those who were with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a certain Ananias, a devout man according to the law, well spoken of by all the Jews who live there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came to me and stood by me and said to me, ‘Brother Saul, regain your sight!’ And at that same time I looked up at him and saw him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, ‘The God of our fathers has appointed you to know his will, and to see the Righteous One and to hear a voice from his mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you will be a witness for him to all people of what you have seen and heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now why are you delaying? Get up, be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on his name!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it happened that when I returned to Jerusalem and I was praying in the temple courts, I was in a trance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saw him saying to me, ‘Hurry and depart quickly from Jerusalem, because they will not accept your testimony about me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said, ‘Lord, they themselves know that from synagogue to synagogue I was imprisoning and beating those who believed in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the blood of your witness Stephen was being shed, I myself also was standing near and was approving, and was guarding the cloaks of those who were killing him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me, ‘Go, because I will send you far away to the Gentiles!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were listening to him until this word, and they raised their voices, saying, “Away with such a man from the earth! For it is not fitting for him to live!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were screaming and throwing off their cloaks and throwing dust into the air,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the military tribune ordered him to be brought into the barracks, saying he was to be examined with a lash so that he could find out for what reason they were crying out against him in this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they had stretched him out for the lash, Paul said to the centurion standing there, “Is it permitted for you to flog a man who is a Roman citizen and uncondemned?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the centurion heard this, he went to the military tribune and reported it, saying, “What are you about to do? For this man is a Roman citizen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the military tribune came and said to him, “Tell me, are you a Roman citizen?” And he said, “Yes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the military tribune replied, “I acquired this citizenship for a large sum of money.” And Paul said, “But I indeed was born a citizen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then immediately those who were about to examine him kept away from him, and the military tribune also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman citizen and that he had tied him up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the next day, because he wanted to know the true reason why he was being accused by the Jews, he released him and ordered the chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin to assemble, and he brought down Paul and had him stand before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And looking intently at the Sanhedrin, Paul said, “Men and brothers, I have lived my life in all good conscience before God to this day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near him to strike his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Paul said to him, “God is going to strike you, you whitewashed wall! And are you sitting there judging me according to the law, and acting contrary to the law do you order me to be struck?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who stood nearby said, “Are you reviling the high priest of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul said, “I did not know, brothers, that he was high priest. For it is written, ‘You must not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Paul realized that one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he shouted out in the Sanhedrin, “Men and brothers! I am a Pharisee, a son of Pharisees! I am being judged concerning the hope and the resurrection of the dead!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he said this, a dispute developed between the Pharisees and Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the Sadducees say there is no resurrection or angel or spirit, but the Pharisees acknowledge them all.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was loud shouting, and some of the scribes from the party of the Pharisees stood up and contended sharply, saying, “We find nothing wrong with this man! But what if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the dispute became severe, the military tribune, fearing lest Paul be torn apart by them, ordered the detachment to go down, take him away from their midst, and bring him into the barracks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the next night the Lord stood by him and said, “Have courage, for as you have testified about me in Jerusalem, so you must also testify in Rome.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was day, the Jews made a conspiracy and bound themselves under a curse, saying they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were more than forty who had made this conspiracy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who went to the chief priests and the elders and said, “We have bound ourselves under a curse to partake of nothing until we have killed Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, now you along with the Sanhedrin explain to the military tribune that he should bring him down to you, as if you were going to determine more accurately the things concerning him. And we are ready to do away with him before he comes near.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the son of Paul’s sister heard about the ambush, he came and entered into the barracks and reported it to Paul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Paul called one of the centurions and said, “Bring this young man to the military tribune, because he has something to report to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he took him and brought him to the military tribune and said, “The prisoner Paul called me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the military tribune, taking hold of his hand and withdrawing privately, asked, “What is it that you have to report to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, “The Jews have agreed to ask you that you bring Paul down to the Sanhedrin tomorrow, as if they were going to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You therefore do not be persuaded by them, because more than forty men of their number are lying in wait for him, who have bound themselves under a curse neither to eat nor to drink until they have done away with him. And now they are ready, waiting for you to agree.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the military tribune sent the young man away, directing him, “Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he summoned two of the centurions and said, “Make ready from the third hour of the night two hundred soldiers and seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen, in order that they may proceed as far as Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And provide mounts so that they can put Paul on them and bring him safely to Felix the governor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He wrote a letter that had this form:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Claudius Lysias.
To his excellency Governor Felix.
Greetings!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man was seized by the Jews and was about to be killed by them when I came upon them with the detachment and rescued him, because I learned that he was a Roman citizen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because I wanted to know the charge for which they were accusing him, I brought him down to their Sanhedrin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I found he was accused concerning controversial questions of their law, but having no charge deserving death or imprisonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was made known to me there would be a plot against the man, I sent him to you immediately, also ordering his accusers to speak against him before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the soldiers, in accordance with their orders, took Paul and brought him to Antipatris during the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the next day they let the horsemen go on with him, and they returned to the barracks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The horsemen, when they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor, also presented Paul to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after reading the letter and asking what province he was from, and learning that he was from Cilicia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he said, “I will give you a hearing whenever your accusers arrive also,” giving orders for him to be guarded in the praetorium of Herod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after five days the high priest Ananias came down with some elders and an attorney, a certain Tertullus, all of whom brought charges against Paul to the governor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he had been summoned, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying, “We have experienced much peace through you, and reforms are taking place in this nation through your foresight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both in every way and everywhere we acknowledge this, most excellent Felix, with all gratitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But so that I may not impose on you for longer, I implore you to hear us briefly with your customary graciousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have found this man to be a public menace and one who causes riots among all the Jews throughout the Roman Empire and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who even attempted to desecrate the temple, and we arrested him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you yourself examine him you will be able to find out from him about all these things of which we are accusing him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jews also joined in the attack, asserting these things were so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the governor gestured for him to speak, Paul replied, “Because I know you have been a judge over this nation for many years, I defend myself cheerfully with respect to the things concerning myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You can ascertain that it has not been more than twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem to worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And neither did they find me arguing with anyone or making a crowd develop in the temple courts nor in the synagogues nor throughout the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor can they prove the things to you concerning which they are now accusing me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I do confess this to you, that according to the Way (which they call a sect), so I worship the God of our fathers, believing all things that are in accordance with the law and that are written in the prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a hope in God which these men also themselves await: that there is going to be a resurrection of both the righteous and the unrighteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason also I myself always do my best to have a clear conscience toward God and people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after many years, I came to practice charitable giving and offerings to my people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which they found me purified in the temple courts, not with a crowd or with a disturbance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there are some Jews from Asia who ought to be present before you and bring charges against me, if they have anything against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or these men themselves should say what crime they found when I stood before the Sanhedrin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: other than concerning this one declaration that I shouted while standing there before them: ‘I am being judged before you today concerning the resurrection of the dead!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Felix, because he understood the facts concerning the Way more accurately, put them off, saying, “When Lysias the military tribune comes down, I will decide your case.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He ordered the centurion for him to be guarded and to have some freedom, and in no way to prevent any of his own people from serving him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after some days, when Felix arrived with his wife Drusilla, who was Jewish, he sent for Paul and listened to him concerning faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while he was discussing about righteousness and self control and the judgment that is to come, Felix became afraid and replied, “Go away for the present, and when I have an opportunity, I will summon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the same time he was also hoping that money would be given to him by Paul. For this reason also he sent for him as often as possible and talked with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when two years had passed, Felix received as successor Porcius Festus. And because he wanted to do a favor for the Jews, Felix left Paul behind as a prisoner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Festus set foot in the province, after three days he went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the chief priests and the most prominent men of the Jews brought charges against Paul to him, and were urging him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: asking for a favor against him, that he summon him to Jerusalem, because they were preparing an ambush to do away with him along the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Festus replied that Paul was being kept at Caesarea, and he himself was about to go there in a short time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he said, “Let those among you who are prominent go down with me, and if there is any wrong in the man, let them bring charges against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he had stayed among them not more than eight or ten days, he went down to Caesarea. On the next day he sat down on the judgment seat and gave orders for Paul to be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he arrived, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing many and serious charges that they were not able to prove,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while Paul said in his defense, “Neither against the law of the Jews nor against the temple nor against Caesar have I sinned with reference to anything!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Festus, because he wanted to do a favor for the Jews, answered and said to Paul, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem to be tried before me there concerning these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am standing before the judgment seat of Caesar, where it is necessary for me to be judged. I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If then I am doing wrong and have done anything deserving death, I am not trying to avoid dying. But if there is nothing true of the things which these people are accusing me, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Festus, after discussing this with his council, replied, “You have appealed to Caesar—to Caesar you will go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after some days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to welcome Festus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while they were staying there many days, Festus laid out the case against Paul to the king, saying, “There is a certain man left behind by Felix as a prisoner,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning whom when I was in Jerusalem the chief priests and the elders of the Jews presented evidence, asking for a sentence of condemnation against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them I replied that it was not the custom of the Romans to give up any man before the one who had been accused met his accusers face to face and received an opportunity for a defense concerning the accusation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, when they had assembled here, I made no delay; on the next day I sat down on the judgment seat and gave orders for the man to be brought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they stood up, his accusers began bringing no charge concerning him of the evil deeds that I was suspecting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but they had some issues with him concerning their own religion, and concerning a certain Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul claimed to be alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because I was at a loss with regard to the investigation concerning these things, I asked if he was willing to go to Jerusalem and to be judged there concerning these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Paul appealed that he be kept under guard for the decision of His Majesty the Emperor, I gave orders for him to be kept under guard until I could send him to Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Agrippa said to Festus, “I want to hear the man myself also.” “Tomorrow,” he said, “you will hear him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So on the next day, Agrippa and Bernice came with great pageantry and entered into the audience hall, along with military tribunes and the most prominent men of the city. And when Festus gave the order, Paul was brought in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Festus said, “King Agrippa and all who are present with us, you see this man about whom the whole population of the Jews appealed to me, both in Jerusalem and here, shouting that he must not live any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I understood that he had done nothing deserving death himself, and when this man appealed to His Majesty the Emperor, I decided to send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not have anything definite to write to my lord about him. Therefore I have brought him before you all—and especially before you, King Agrippa—so that after this preliminary hearing has taken place, I may have something to write.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it seems unreasonable to me to send a prisoner and not to indicate the charges against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Agrippa said to Paul, “It is permitted for you to speak for yourself.” Then Paul extended his hand and began to defend himself:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Concerning all the things of which I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa, I consider myself fortunate that before you I am about to defend myself today,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because you are especially acquainted with both all the customs and controversial questions with respect to the Jews. Therefore I beg you to listen to me with patience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now all the Jews know my manner of life from my youth, that had taken place from the beginning among my own people and in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having known me for a long time, if they are willing to testify, that in accordance with the strictest party of our religion I lived as a Pharisee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now I stand here on trial on the basis of hope in the promise made by God to our fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to which our twelve tribes hope to attain as they earnestly serve him night and day. Concerning this hope I am being accused by the Jews, O king!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why is it thought incredible by you people that God raises the dead?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I myself thought it was necessary to do many things opposed to the name of Jesus the Nazarene,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which I also did in Jerusalem, and not only did I lock up many of the saints in prison, having received authority from the chief priests, but also when they were being executed, I cast my vote against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And throughout all the synagogues I punished them often and tried to force them to blaspheme, and because I was enraged at them beyond measure, I was pursuing them even as far as to foreign cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this activity I was traveling to Damascus with the authority and full power of the chief priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the middle of the day along the road, O king, I saw a light from heaven, more than the brightness of the sun, shining around me and those who were traveling with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when we had all fallen to the ground, I heard a voice saying to me in the Aramaic language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I said, ‘Who are you, Lord?’ And the Lord said, ‘I am Jesus whom you are persecuting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But get up and stand on your feet, because for this reason I have appeared to you, to appoint you a servant and witness both to the things in which you saw me and to the things in which I will appear to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rescuing you from the people and from the Gentiles to whom I am sending you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to open their eyes so that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God, so that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a share among those who are sanctified by faith in me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, O King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but to those in Damascus first, and in Jerusalem and all the region of Judea and to the Gentiles, I proclaimed that they should repent and turn to God, doing deeds worthy of repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On account of these things the Jews seized me in the temple courts and were attempting to kill me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I have experienced help from God until this day, and I stand here testifying to both small and great, saying nothing except what both the prophets and Moses have said were going to happen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the Christ was to suffer and that as the first of the resurrection from the dead, he was going to proclaim light both to the people and to the Gentiles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as he was saying these things in his defense, Festus said with a loud voice, “You are out of your mind, Paul! Your great learning is driving you insane!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Paul said, “I am not out of my mind, most excellent Festus, but am speaking words of truth and rationality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king knows about these things, to whom also I am speaking freely, for I am not convinced that these things in any way have escaped his notice, because this was not done in a corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you believe the prophets, King Agrippa? I know that you believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Agrippa said to Paul, “In a short time are you persuading me to become a Christian?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Paul replied, “I pray to God, whether in a short time or in a long time, not only you but also all those who are listening to me today may become such people as I also am, except for these bonds!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both the king and the governor got up, and Bernice and those who were sitting with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were going out, they were talking to one another, saying, “This man is not doing anything deserving death or imprisonment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Agrippa said to Festus, “This man could have been released if he had not appealed to Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when it was decided that we would sail away to Italy, they handed over Paul and some other prisoners to a centurion named Julius of the Augustan Cohort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we went aboard a ship from Adramyttium that was about to sail to the places along the coast of Asia and put out to sea. Aristarchus, a Macedonian from Thessalonica, was with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the next day, we put in at Sidon. And Julius, treating Paul kindly, allowed him to go to his friends to be cared for.
verses.speaker: Narrator
